item.title: Present and Future of Kotlin for Web
item.description: TL;DR: We remain committed to empowering Kotlin developers with robust and seamless support in Kotlin Multiplatform for web development. To achieve this, we are working on several key areas: Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) aims to help developers share code across different platforms, significantly reducing development time and effort. The web plays a crucial role in this [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2025/05/present-and-future-kotlin-for-web/

[DTRC-31451] For the full list of resolved [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/05/08/resharper-rider-2025-1-2-bug-fix/

item.title: New Single Sign On Is Here!
item.description: Configure SSO in Qodana Cloud with just a few clicks. If you have a Qodana license with at least 10 users, you can now configure custom single sign on (SSO) support for Qodana Cloud. Quick and easy sign-ons are just another way to make access easier and improve the login experience for your team. Watch [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/qodana/2025/05/new-single-sign-on-is-here/

item.title: CLion Is Now Free for Non-Commercial Use

item.title: Compose Multiplatform 1.8.0 Released: Compose Multiplatform for iOS Is Stable and Production-Ready
item.description: Today marks a major milestone in the Kotlin Multiplatform journey: the release of Compose Multiplatform 1.8.0, which brings Compose for iOS to Stable. With this update, Kotlin Multiplatform becomes a complete solution for mobile development, enabling flexible code sharing across both business logic and UI without compromising app quality or losing control over platform-specific capabilities. [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2025/05/compose-multiplatform-1-8-0-released-compose-multiplatform-for-ios-is-stable-and-production-ready/

item.title: A Study in CDEs: Building CodeCanvas with CodeCanvas
item.description: JetBrains CodeCanvas is a tool for orchestrating Cloud Development Environments (CDEs). These environments aim to solve some of the long-standing issues of local development setups: tedious onboarding, environment drift, resource-heavy builds, and more.¬†When we started building CodeCanvas, we knew dogfooding would be essential. Our goal was to experience the product the same way users [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/codecanvas/2025/05/building-with-codecanvas/

item.title: Java Annotated Monthly ‚Äì May 2025
item.description: Welcome to the May edition of Java Annotated Monthly! This month, we have a special guest ‚Äì Anton Arhipov. He joins us to share standout articles and other discoveries that recently caught his expert eye. Alongside his picks, you‚Äôll find your regular dose of Java and tech news, AI updates, and industry events that are [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2025/05/java-annotated-monthly-may-2025/

item.title: dotInsights | May 2025
item.description: Did you know? C# allows you to define custom operators for your own types by overloading built-in operators (like +, -, ==, etc.). This is not something most developers use often, and it can make your code behave like native types, which is a powerful but underutilized feature. Welcome to dotInsights by JetBrains! This newsletter [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/05/06/dotinsights-may-2025/

item.title: Making WebStorm Faster: How We‚Äôre Improving Performance Behind the Scenes
item.description: At WebStorm, performance isn‚Äôt a side project ‚Äì it‚Äôs a core part of what we do. Every millisecond counts when you‚Äôre deep in the flow, writing and navigating code. We‚Äôve heard your feedback loud and clear: performance issues break that flow, and they‚Äôre frustrating. That‚Äôs why improving speed, responsiveness, and reliability is one of our [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/webstorm/2025/05/improving-webstorm-performance-behind-the-scenes/

item.title: JetBrains Academy ‚Äì April Digest

item.title: Qodana 2025.1 Release
